intro: Pentacalia tablensis, commonly known as the Tablense pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and produces clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture. Pentacalia tablensis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
